title: metabolonize
text: requirement package work CLIENT_SAMPLE_ID colnames summarized experiment.
code: library("metabolonize") #> Warning: replacing previous import 'S4Arrays::makeNindexFromArrayViewport' by #> 'DelayedArray::makeNindexFromArrayViewport' when loading 'SummarizedExperiment' suppressPackageStartupMessages({   library("macrophage")   library("SummarizedExperiment")   library("limma")   library("edgeR")   library("DESeq2") }) cdt_path <- system.file("extdata", "example_data_tables.XLSX", package = "metabolonize")  data(gse) rownames(gse) <- substr(rownames(gse), 1, 15) # per togliere tutto quello dopo il punto dds <- DESeqDataSet(gse, design = ~condition) #> using counts and average transcript lengths from tximeta  keep <- rowSums(counts(dds) >= 10) >= 6 dds <- dds[keep, ]  dds <- DESeq(dds) #> estimating size factors #> using 'avgTxLength' from assays(dds), correcting for library size #> estimating dispersions #> gene-wise dispersion estimates #> mean-dispersion relationship #> final dispersion estimates #> fitting model and testing condition <- factor(colData(gse)[, "condition_name"])  design <- model.matrix(~ 0 + condition) colnames(design) <- levels(condition)  contrast.matrix <- makeContrasts(   IFNg_vs_naive = IFNg - naive,   levels = design )  d0 <- DGEList(assay(gse)) d0 <- calcNormFactors(d0)  cutoff <- 1 drop <- which(apply(cpm(d0), 1, max) < cutoff) d <- d0[-drop, ]  matrix_to_fit_model_to <- voom(d, design, plot = F) # matrix_to_fit_model_to <- assay(se) # Use the assay data from the SummarizedExperiment object  fit <- lmFit(matrix_to_fit_model_to, design) # fit2 <- contrasts.fit(fit, contrast.matrix)  # View(as.data.frame(colData(se))) fit2 <- eBayes(fit2) res_macrophage_IFNg_vs_naive_dds <- results(dds,   contrast = c("condition", "IFNg", "naive"),   lfcThreshold = 1, alpha = 0.05 ) summary(res_macrophage_IFNg_vs_naive_dds) #>  #> out of 17806 with nonzero total read count #> adjusted p-value < 0.05 #> LFC > 1.00 (up)    : 416, 2.3% #> LFC < -1.00 (down) : 141, 0.79% #> outliers [1]       : 95, 0.53% #> low counts [2]     : 0, 0% #> (mean count < 3) #> [1] see 'cooksCutoff' argument of ?results #> [2] see 'independentFiltering' argument of ?results res_macrophage_IFNg_vs_naive_limma <- topTable(fit2, coef = "IFNg_vs_naive", adjust = "fdr", number = Inf, confint = TRUE)

title: metabolonize
text: can call two functions convert data format can uploaded Metabolon platform multiomics section. automatically formats results DESeq2 limma required format. addition can also convert assay data summarized experiment object format requested Metabolon using function se_to_metabolon. package works also limma results using topTable format:

title: metabolonize
text: can also convert Metabolon Client data table file SummarizedExperiment object using function cdt_to_se, able easily import data R continue analysis.
code: se <- cdt_to_se(   cdt = cdt_path,   output_file = "test/cdt_to_se_bni.rds",   save_file = F,   data_type = "batch_norm_imputed" ) se #> class: SummarizedExperiment  #> dim: 6 24  #> metadata(0): #> assays(1): counts #> rownames(6): FAKEINCHIKEY00001 FAKEINCHIKEY00002 ... FAKEINCHIKEY00005 #>   FAKEINCHIKEY00006 #> rowData names(21): CHEM_ID LIB_ID ... PUBCHEM PLATFORM #> colnames(24): TEST-1 TEST-2 ... TEST-23 TEST-24 #> colData names(34): PARENT_SAMPLE_NAME CLIENT_IDENTIFIER ... TREATMENT #>   WT_KO library(SingleCellExperiment) #>  #> Attaching package: 'SingleCellExperiment' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:edgeR': #>  #>     cpm, tpm  sce <- as(se, "SingleCellExperiment")  # As you can see here we can add dimensionality reductions (as many as we need) to the object using the capabilities of a single cell summarized experiment pca_result <- prcomp(t(assay(se)))  reducedDim(sce, "PCA") <- pca_result$x

title: Metabolon Interface
text: package used interface standard bioinformatics pipelines metabolon software

title: Metabolon Interface
text: https://github.com/edo98811/metabolon_summarized_experiment.git install package, can use remotes package R:
code: # Install the remotes package if you haven't already install.packages("remotes")  # Use remotes to install the package from GitHub remotes::install_github("edo98811/metabolon_summarized_experiment")

what: Convert CDT File to SummarizedExperiment Object — cdt_to_se
title: Convert CDT File to SummarizedExperiment Object — cdt_to_se
text: function reads CDT (Client Data Table) Excel file converts SummarizedExperiment object. function allows selecting specific data types optionally saves resulting object file.

title: Convert CDT File to SummarizedExperiment Object — cdt_to_se
code: cdt_to_se(   cdt,   output_file = NULL,   save_file = T,   data_type = "batch_norm_imputed",   rowdata_key = "INCHIKEY" )

title: Convert CDT File to SummarizedExperiment Object — cdt_to_se
text: cdt Character. Path CDT Excel file. Must exist. output_file Character. Path save resulting SummarizedExperiment object. NULL save_file TRUE, default filename generated. save_file Logical. Whether save resulting SummarizedExperiment object file. Default TRUE. FALSE, object returned. path provided, default filename generated based current date saved working directory. data_type Character. type data extract CDT file. Options : "peak_area": Extracts peak area data (sheet 4). "batch_norm": Extracts batch normalized data (sheet 5). "batch_norm_imputed": Extracts batch normalized imputed data (sheet 6). "mass_extracted": Extracts mass extracted data (sheet 7). "log_transformed": Extracts log-transformed data (sheet 8). Default "batch_norm_imputed". rowdata_key Character. column name row data (sheet 2) use row names.

title: Convert CDT File to SummarizedExperiment Object — cdt_to_se
text: SummarizedExperiment object containing: assays: assay data extracted CDT file. rowData: Metadata rows (e.g., compounds). colData: Metadata columns (e.g., samples).

title: Convert CDT File to SummarizedExperiment Object — cdt_to_se
text: function performs following steps: Validates existence provided CDT. Reads metadata (sheet 3) row data (sheet 2) CDT file. Extracts assay data based specified data_type. Cleans formats metadata row data. componds kept ones non-NA value selected row data (annotation) column. Ensures consistency metadata assay data dimensions. Constructs SummarizedExperiment object. Optionally saves resulting object file save_file TRUE.

title: Convert CDT File to SummarizedExperiment Object — cdt_to_se
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Convert a CDT file to a SummarizedExperiment object se <- cdt_to_se(   cdt = "path/to/cdt_file.xlsx",   save_file = FALSE,   data_type = "log_transformed" ) } # }

what: Prepare results for Metabolon upload — make_results_for_metabolon
title: Prepare results for Metabolon upload — make_results_for_metabolon
text: function transforms results tables (limma, DESeq2, custom formats) format compatible Metabolon multi-omics module.

title: Prepare results for Metabolon upload — make_results_for_metabolon
Prepare results for Metabolon upload — make_results_for_metabolon
text: table data frame containing results differential expression analysis. format character string specifying format input table. Options "topTable" (limma), "DESeqResults" (DESeq2), "edgeR" (yet supported), "Custom". Default "topTable". omics character string specifying type omics data. Default "transcriptomics". custom_colnames character vector specifying custom column names "Custom" format. Must include least "p-value", "FDR", "FC". Default NULL.

title: Prepare results for Metabolon upload — make_results_for_metabolon
text: data frame formatted Metabolon, columns: Feature, Omics, p-value, FDR, FC.

what: Clean and format the row data from the CDT file — make_rowdata
title: Clean and format the row data from the CDT file — make_rowdata
text: Clean format row data CDT file

title: Clean and format the row data from the CDT file — make_rowdata
Clean and format the row data from the CDT file — make_rowdata
text: rowdata data frame containing row data CDT file. rowdata_key character string specifying column name use row names.

title: Clean and format the row data from the CDT file — make_rowdata
text: cleaned formatted row data data frame.

what: Map Gene Identifiers to Ensembl IDs This function maps gene identifiers (gene symbols or UniProt IDs) to Ensembl Gene IDs using the appropriate organism database. — map_genes
title: Map Gene Identifiers to Ensembl IDs This function maps gene identifiers (gene symbols or UniProt IDs) to Ensembl Gene IDs using the appropriate organism database. — map_genes
text: Map Gene Identifiers Ensembl IDs function maps gene identifiers (gene symbols UniProt IDs) Ensembl Gene IDs using appropriate organism database.

title: Map Gene Identifiers to Ensembl IDs This function maps gene identifiers (gene symbols or UniProt IDs) to Ensembl Gene IDs using the appropriate organism database. — map_genes
Map Gene Identifiers to Ensembl IDs This function maps gene identifiers (gene symbols or UniProt IDs) to Ensembl Gene IDs using the appropriate organism database. — map_genes
text: keys_list character vector gene identifiers (gene symbols, UniProt IDs, Ensembl IDs). matrix data frame matrix containing assay data, row names corresponding identifiers keys_list. input_features character string specifying type input features. Options "gene_symbol", "uniprot_id", "ensembl_id". organism character string specifying organism. Can "Mm" (Mus musculus) "Hs" (Homo sapiens). Default "Hs".

title: Map Gene Identifiers to Ensembl IDs This function maps gene identifiers (gene symbols or UniProt IDs) to Ensembl Gene IDs using the appropriate organism database. — map_genes
text: matrix row names updated Ensembl IDs, suitable downstream analysis.

what: Convert Results to Metabolon Format — results_to_metabolon
title: Convert Results to Metabolon Format — results_to_metabolon
text: function converts differential expression analysis results (limma, DESeq2, custom formats) format compatible Metabolon multi-omics module.

title: Convert Results to Metabolon Format — results_to_metabolon
code: results_to_metabolon(   table,   format = "topTable",   omics = "Transcriptomics",   custom_colnames = NULL,   output_file = NULL,   input_features = "ensembl_id",   organism = "Hs",   save_file = T )

title: Convert Results to Metabolon Format — results_to_metabolon
text: table data frame containing results differential expression analysis. format character string specifying format input table. Options "topTable" (limma), "DESeqResults" (DESeq2), "edgeR" (yet supported), "Custom". Default "topTable". omics character string specifying type omics data. Default "transcriptomics". custom_colnames character vector specifying custom column names "Custom" format. Must include least "p-value", "FDR", "FC". Default NULL. output_file character string specifying output file path. NULL save_file TRUE, default file name generated. Default NULL. input_features character string specifying type input features. Options "gene_symbol", "uniprot_id", "ensembl_id". Default "ensembl_id". organism character string specifying organism. Can "Mm" "Hs". Default "Hs" (Homo sapiens). save_file logical value indicating whether save output file. Default TRUE. path provided, default filename generated based current date saved working directory.

title: Convert Results to Metabolon Format — results_to_metabolon
text: data frame formatted Metabolon, columns: Feature, Omics, p-value, FDR, FC.

title: Convert Results to Metabolon Format — results_to_metabolon
text: function checks correctness input format ensures required columns present input table. supports workflows "topTable" (limma), "DESeqResults" (DESeq2), "Custom" formats. "edgeR" format yet supported.

title: Convert Results to Metabolon Format — results_to_metabolon
code: # Example usage with limma::topTable results if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ results <- limma::topTable(fit) metabolon_results <- results_to_metabolon(results, format = "topTable")  # Example usage with DESeq2::results results <- DESeq2::results(dds) metabolon_results <- results_to_metabolon(results, format = "DESeqResults")  # Example usage with custom format custom_results <- data.frame(   p_value = c(0.01, 0.05),   FDR = c(0.02, 0.06),   FC = c(1.5, -1.2) ) metabolon_results <- results_to_metabolon(custom_results, format = "Custom",                                            custom_colnames = c("p_value", "FDR", "FC")) } # }

what: Convert SummarizedExperiment to Metabolon Format — se_to_metabolon
title: Convert SummarizedExperiment to Metabolon Format — se_to_metabolon
text: function converts SummarizedExperiment object format compatible Metabolon data analysis.

title: Convert SummarizedExperiment to Metabolon Format — se_to_metabolon
code: se_to_metabolon(   se,   cdt,   input_features = "ensembl_id",   output_file = NULL,   organism = "Hs",   save_file = TRUE,   sample_id_column = "CLIENT_SAMPLE_ID" )

title: Convert SummarizedExperiment to Metabolon Format — se_to_metabolon
text: se SummarizedExperiment (derived) object. input data converted. cdt client data table metabolon. input_features character string specifying type input features. Options "ensembl_id" (default), "gene_symbol", "uniprot_id". output_file character string specifying path save output file. NULL save_file TRUE, default filename generated. organism character string specifying organism. Default "Hs" (Homo sapiens), Options : "Mm". save_file logical vawrlue indicating whether save output file. Default TRUE. sample_id_column column metadata needs matched sample id gse.

title: Convert SummarizedExperiment to Metabolon Format — se_to_metabolon
text: transposed assay matrix row names column names formatted according standard required metabolon.

title: Convert SummarizedExperiment to Metabolon Format — se_to_metabolon
text: function checks input object SummarizedExperiment. Metadata read CDT. Annotations created based specified organism input features. assay matrix transposed formatted according metabolon standard. save_file TRUE, output written CSV file.

title: Convert SummarizedExperiment to Metabolon Format — se_to_metabolon
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ se <- SummarizedExperiment::SummarizedExperiment() result <- se_to_metabolon(se, cdt = "cdt.xlsx", input_features = "gene_symbol", save_file = TRUE) } # }
